<cs> my lords i rise with some diffidence and trepidation to address your lordships in this arena which for me is unfamiliar <e> <s> please forgive me if i unwittingly break any of your lordships rules <e> <s> your lordships attention has been directed properly to the courts to the police and to statistics <e> <s> so far as statistics are concerned i propose to say nothing except that they are mostly misleading and very largely unintelligible <e> <s> so far as the police are concerned i just wish to say that they can operate only with the consent and with the active help of law-abiding citizens <e> <s> what can destroy the efficacy of the police more quickly than anything else is the undermining of their authority by people who ought to know better <e>

<cs> my lords i rise with some diffidence for this reason i appreciate that a judges view may very well be distorted by the fact that he deals largely with the pathology of society <e> <s> speaking for myself and i am neither a sociologist nor a criminologist and nor can i drive a horse whether it belongs to my noble and learned friend lord elwyn-jones or not or whether it is kicking or not i too was misled by the terms of this motion <e> <s> it seems to imply as the noble lord lord hooson has indicated that there is some connection between the rise in violent crime and the failure to reintroduce the death penalty the suggestion being as i understood it initially that were hanging to be reintroduced there would be a sudden improvement in the violent crime figures <e> <s> i was very glad to hear from the most reverend primate that that despite the appearance of the motion was not what it meant <e>

<cs> i am incapable of the sort of histrionics we have just heard <e> <s> anything i say will be by comparison at any rate extremely dull <e> <s> i support this amendment <e> <s> it is purely a matter of practical and very dull politics <e> <s> i am unmoved by lord campbells bank managers wife <e> <s> she deserves to be treated in exactly the same way as anybody else <e> <s> nor is anyone altering any fundamental legal principles <e> <s> the fundamental legal principle is that no one is convicted unless the prosecution proves the case so that the jury or the magistrates feel sure <e> <s> that is the fundamental principle and that is not in issue here <e> <s> without going into any statistics there is no doubt that a very significant proportion of valuable crown court time is taken up by dealing with this sort of case <e> <s> it was said that per cent <e> <s> is the figure <e> <s> i do not know and i would not quarrel with that <e> <s> we are also told that the cost of one day in the crown court runs into thousands of pounds something like or <e> <s> we all know particularly in the south-east that the delay in criminal trials is unacceptable <e> <s> try as one will it is almost impossible to keep pace with the increase in the number of offences sent for trial which i think has risen by per cent <e> <s> in the past six or seven years <e> <s> in addition we now find the crown prosecution service desperately short of money <e>
